originalProjects.title: Personal Website
description: This is my first non-tutorial personal project. I did everything on my ownâ€”with Google and Stack Overflow, of course.

The design of this Website is mainly inspired by Hayden Bleasel's personal website. The CV page of this website utilizes the PDFObject JavaScript utility. The Recommendation section utilizes Ken Wheeler's Slick carousel.

originalProjects.title: Color Flipping Game
description: This project is associated with the course CSC1002 I took in the second term of my first year at CUHKSZ.

I made this color flipping game from scratch using Python and its Turtle graphics library. To bring it a step further, I implemented a non-recursive flipping algorithm instead of the template recursive program.
additionalDescription: The goal of this game is to turn all tiles to the same color. The player should do this by choosing one tile on the board and then selecting another color on the color pallette. The selected tile and its same-colored neighbors will subsequently change to the color selected on the pallette.

tutorialProjects.title: Blog with Database
description: I made this project in Section 23 & 30, which are Boss Level Challenges 3 & 4 in The Complete 2022 Web Development Bootcamp.

The skeleton HTML and CSS were provided by the instructor. My part was implementing Express.js, EJS, and MongoDB to the Web App. I used Mongoose as a library for connecting to MongoDB, setup MongoDB Atlas, and deployed the App to Heroku.

tutorialProjects.title: To Do List
description: I made this project in Section 22 & 28 of The Complete 2022 Web Development Bootcamp.
Aside from implementing Express.js and EJS, this was my first introduction to databases to persist data. I learned to use MongoDB and the Mongoose and Lodash library.

tutorialProjects.title: Others
description: In Section 31 of The Complete 2022 Web Development Bootcamp, I learned to build my own RESTful API. I'd like to implement RESTful API to my future projects.

In Section 32 of The Complete 2022 Web Development Bootcamp, I learned about Authentication & Security from the simple username and password, database encryption, salting and hashing passwords, cookies and sessions, and up to using OAuth 2.0 and implementing sign in with Google. I also used the Passport authentication middleware.
